intro: Spermacoce alternans, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often with five petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
